2.text: Pour your pudding mixture into your greased mold.

3.text: Cut one square of grease-proof paper and one square of tinfoil.

4.text: Fold the grease-proof paper inside of the tinfoil to make a pleat.

6.text: Tie the foil and paper to the mold with a length of twine.

7.text: Thread another length of twine to create a handle.

8.text: Fill a pot with about 2 in (5.1 cm) of water.

9.text: Place the steamer basket inside the pot and turn it to medium heat.

10.text: Put your pudding in the pot, then cover it for 1 to 2 hours.

11.text: Top up the water if the pot dries out.

13.text: Place your covered mold in a deep roasting pan.

14.text: Pour 2 in (5.1 cm) of water into the roasting pan.

16.text: Place your pudding mold in the center of your slow cooker.

17.text: Fill the slow cooker up about halfway with water.

18.text: Cover the slow cooker and cook on high for 3 to 4 hours.

19.text: Take the pudding out of the pot and cut the string.

20.text: Slide a knife in between the pudding and the mold.

21.text: Flip the pudding upside down onto a plate.

22.text: Serve the pudding with cream, custard, or hard sauce.
